title: Gold stretches losses to a second day and 9-month lows; silver slides to weakest since summer 2020
text:
* Gold futures GC00 GCQ22 for August delivery fell $4.60, or 0.3%, to $1,727.10 an ounce after touching a low at $1,721.60. Prices haven't traded at levels this low since September, FactSet data show.

* Silver futures SIU22 for September delivery fell 31.2 cents, or 1.6%, to $18.82, poised for their lowest finish since July 2020.

* Platinum futures PLV22 for October delivery were down $30, or 3.5%, to $830.70 per ounce.

* Palladium futures PAU22 for September delivery were down $48.60, or 2.2%, to $2,123 per ounce.

* Copper prices HGU22 for September delivery were down 12.1 cents, or 3.5%, to $3.3095 per pound.

What's driving the market ?

Since gold hit its 2022 peak north of $2,000 per ounce back in March, it has been largely driven by the strong dollar which is at a 20-year high based on the index DXY measuring its strength against major currencies, while higher Treasury yields, which have stolen some of the precious metals' luster in the eyes of investors.

Analysts at TD Securities blamed relative weakness in precious metals and crude oil on the broader "risk off" mood on Tuesday. U.S. benchmark stock indexes were mixed, while the dollar DXY, which has established itself as the market's preferred safe-haven asset, continued to climb toward parity with the euro EURUSD.

See: Euro slips closer to parity as Goldman warns the ECB could respond more 'forcefully' to a weak currency'

"The worst inflationary environment in four decades has not proved helpful for gold prices, which are pacing towards a fresh round of yearly lows versus the U.S. dollar," said Chris Vecchio, a strategist at DailyFX, in emailed commentary. Gold prices remain on track to move below $1,700 over the coming months, he said.

Other markets

* S&P 500 index SPX was down 0.3%.

* The Dow Industrial Average DJIA tacked on 0.1%.

* The dollar was trading within one cent of parity with the euro EURUSD.

* The 10-year Treasury yield BX:TMUBMUSD10Y shed 8 basis points to trade at 2.92%, dropping further below 3%.

Gold stretches losses to a second day and 9-month lows; silver slides to weakest since summer 2020
